links.quantification: 100K chargers enable 5M EVs by 2030 → 20% urban transport electrified → 30% NOx reduction → ₹30K Cr health savings
Smart charging enables solar integration → charge during daytime surplus → reduces grid evening peak by 15 GW
20% parking mandate → 2M building chargers → enables residential EV adoption without public charging dependency
Curbside chargers repurpose 10% parking spaces → generates ₹5K Cr/year revenue → funds pedestrian infrastructure
Grid capacity gap: 100K chargers need 10 GW capacity → requires ₹50K Cr grid upgrades → 3-year infrastructure lag
Retrofit resistance: Existing buildings lack electrical capacity → 20M apartments need panel upgrades at ₹2L each
Charging equity gap: 80% chargers in affluent areas → low-income neighborhoods underserved → reinforces mobility inequality
Chargers → more EVs → higher demand for RE → battery storage viable → grid flexibility increases (positive feedback)
Requires renewable integration: Charging infrastructure only sustainable with 60%+ RE → coal-powered EVs negate air quality benefits
Via EV demand: 5M EVs → battery manufacturing scale-up → ₹1L Cr investment → 500K jobs in battery sector
Via battery demand: Lithium mining expansion → habitat disruption in Chile/Australia → requires recycling (40% lithium from recycling by 2030)
Via emissions reduction: 30% NOx cut → respiratory illness -20% → children's school attendance improves → community health benefits
Reduced fossil fuel demand → less oil extraction → offshore drilling pressure reduced → marine ecosystem protection
